t: To the Chief Musician. With flutes. A Psalm of David.
Give*pn ear to my words, O Lord,*s Consider*ld my meditation.
Give*ld heed to the voice of my cry, My*ld King and my God, For*ld to You I will pray.
My*ld voice You shall hear in the morning, O Lord;*s In*ld the morning I will direct it*i to You, And*ld I will look up.
For*ln You are*i not a God who takes pleasure in wickedness, Nor*ld shall evil dwell with You.
The*ld boastful shall not stand in Your sight; You*ld hate all workers of iniquity.
You*ld shall destroy those who speak falsehood; The*ld Lord*s abhors the bloodthirsty and deceitful man.
But*ln as for me, I will come into Your house in the multitude of Your mercy; In*ld fear of You I will worship toward Your holy temple.
Lead*ld me, O Lord,*s in Your righteousness because of my enemies; Make*ld Your way straight before my face.
For*ln there*i is*i no faithfulness in their mouth; Their*ld inward part is*i destruction; Their*ld throat is*i an open tomb; They*ld flatter with their tongue.
Pronounce*ld them guilty, O God! Let*ld them fall by their own counsels; Cast*ld them out in the multitude of their transgressions, For*ld they have rebelled against You.
But*ln let all those rejoice who put their trust in You; Let*ld them ever shout for joy, because You defend them; Let*ld those also who love Your name Be*ld joyful in You.
For*ld You, O Lord,*s will bless the righteous; With*ld favor You will surround him as with*i a shield.
